Description: Complete scarab, made of beige steatite. Faint traces of a light green glazing preserved. The head is divided from the prothorax by a single line. The prothorax is divided from the elytra in one downwards bended line. The humeral callosities are indicated by hollowed out triangles. The suture is shown in a single line and one line surrounds the elytra and the prothorax. The head is stylized by a long thin band with the width of the whole scarab, no eyes visible. The clypeus is divided from the head by a single line, three small notches divide it in four lobes. The side shows two circumferential parallel lines indicating the legs on top of the base plate. The seal at the base is surrounded by an oval line framing the base. At both longitudinal ends a nb-basket, in the middle a column of mn on top of a horizontal sign, probably n over two t. Perforated along its longitudinal side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E12.4C, low level, i.e. above Ramesside floor
